column3: I still disagree that storing the last sizelimit passed to CTxMemPool::TrimToSize() are the right semantics. It strikes me as hackish, unclean and not very reusable.\nI would prefer any of the multiple solutions I offered in #7115. But at that point none of the solutions were acceptable to you, in fact, you were strongly opposed to https://github.com/morcos/bitcoin/commit/cf95aa1225df59139c774ca98

@jtimon Actually the only piece of this I care about is the first commit, storing the sizeLimit in TrimToSize and not having to pass it into GetMinFee.  In my opinion that is the design of the code:
- The mempool is limited (there is no reason for that limit to be static).  
- The size of that limit is set with TrimToSize. (unchanged in this PR)
- GetMinFee does some calculations based on the m
